title: Winter Wonderland NYC
name: Winter Wonderland NYC
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

This is a map of sledding hills and places to get hot chocolate in NYC. If you have a sledding hill or a great hot chocolate joint, add it to the collection.

properties.name: Avenue
properties.description: Posted by 61006  520 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024-3404The best food out here at a moderate price. this place is good for anyone. romantic, kids parties, etc. The Valhorona hot chocolate is thick and amazing. (Gothamist)

properties.name: Barnes and Noble - Austin St
properties.description: Posted by System 70-00 Austin Street, Flushing, NY 11375Storytimes are twice a week: on Tuesdays (Tell-a-Tale) at 11am and Fridays (Fables and Fun) at 1:30pm. All ages are welcome.

properties.name: Barnes and Noble - Bell Blvd
properties.description: Posted by System 23-80 Bell Blvd, Flushing, NY 11360Storytimes are twice a week: on Wednesdays (ages one to four) at 10:30am and Mondays (ages two to six) at 12:30pm.

properties.name: Barnes and Noble - Brooklyn
properties.description: Posted by System 267 7th Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11215Storytimes are on Sundays (ages three to six) at 12n.

properties.name: Barnes and Noble - Staten Island
properties.description: Posted by System 2245 Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY 10314Story Times are offered on Thursdays at 7pm (ages four to six), Tuesdays at 10:30am (ages one to three), and Saturdays at 10:30am (ages one to six).

properties.name: Boat Basin Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System  79th Street at the Hudson River, New York, NY 10024Only open in the spring and summer. Outdoor café. After a hard mornings romp in Riverside Park, the Boat Basin Cafe is a great spot to grab a burger, watch the boats in the Hudson, and wind down. Fish, chicken, and ribs are options, too.

properties.name: Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM)
properties.description: Posted by System  30 Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11217The BAMcafé is open Tuesday-Sunday from 12n-10pm.

properties.name: Cedar Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   another popular Central Park sledding hill.

properties.name: Central park-East Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   An intimate meadow with gently rolling hills. Close to Fifth Avenue. it is easily accessible from Central Park perimeter and invites many visitors who can see it from outside of the Park\'s boundaries.

properties.name: Chocolate Bar
properties.description: Posted by Spoetzl48 8th Ave, New York, NY A big dollop of peanut butter turns the classic hot chocolate into a sweet and salty treat.

properties.name: Chocolate Room
properties.description: Posted by System 86 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NYA Park Slope dessert cafe sweetens up the neighborhood with chocolate confections, plus dessert wine and coffee.

properties.name: City Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Builttospill3 W 18th St, New York, NY Owner Maury Rubin creates an original hot chocolate every day during February, but you can have the excellent original recipe anytime. Home-made marshmallows!

properties.name: Clove Lakes Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Brookside Ave, Staten Island, NY 10310The Urban Park Rangers hold events throughout the year on weekends, including sled races for kids during snowy weekends on the hill along Martlings Avenue.

properties.name: Crocheron Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Crocheron park, Queens, NYThis is considered one of the prettiest parks in the City.

properties.name: Crotona Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Crotona Ave, Bronx, NYGreat sledding. Sometimes a designated city sledding area on "sled days."

properties.name: DT-UT
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau    1626 2nd Avenue, New York, NY 10028A cool and unusual Cafe, DT-UT offers a wonderful gathering place for the stroller set and for parents with young children. The long, deep space, with vintage overstuffed armchairs and sofas pushed back against the walls or in open clusters, offers plenty of room to manoeuver strollers or for toddlers to move around. The style might be described as a cross between your living room and the set for a Cocteau movie. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Dahesh Museum
properties.description: Posted by System    580 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10022Café Opaline is a wonderful place for a family lunch. From 2:30pm-4:45pm every day, the cafe serves both a traditional English Tea service and a special Teddy Bear Tea for Children, featuring PB&J sandwiches, grilled cheese, cookies, and brownies - all served on colorful China. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Ewen Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Johnson Ave, the Bronx, NYConsidered one of the city\'\'s best sledding parks A staircase provides access to the slope, and it’s long and steep enough that a well-balanced rider can pick up serious velocity. The Parks Department put up hay bales at the bottom, but the wise sledder should be ready to bail out before sliding into the street. The atmosphere here may be the best part as sledders are willing to use any imaginable low-friction object to make a sled, and their enthusiasm is palpable.

properties.name: Fairway Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System   2127 Broadway, New York, NY 10023Upstairs from the bustling market, the Fairway Cafe is a smorgasbord of delicious delicacies to delight the youthful palate. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Flushing Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   11101 Corona Ave, Queens, NYSledding, zoo, Shea Stadium

properties.name: Forest Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Park Lane South, Queens, NYThis hill’s velocity, length, bottom run, and fear factor combine for the optimum sledding rush. Located on the golf course, the hill, which, according to the Parks Department, is off-limits and unsafe, draws a crowd of sledders undeterred by icy conditions. Stealthily crafted holes in the protective fence are a yearly tradition.

properties.name: Fort Green Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Myrtle Ave, Brookly, NYpacks in four excellent slopes. Hardy kids rolled down the dozens of steps leading from the Prison Martyrs Ship monument, snowboarders caught air on a longer DeKalb Avenue facing slope, and a slew of first-timers squealed as they coasted down the gentler hill abutting the tennis courts.

properties.name: Fort Tryon Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    dyckman st, New York, NYYou can have a tame experience for young ones, and daredevils slide the steep-grade curving staircase with whiplash turns.

properties.name: Garden Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System   301 South End Avenue, Battery Park City, New York, NY 10280The wall murals are designed to make you feel like you\'\'re sitting in a gazebo - a very big gazebo! (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Greenbelt
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   700 Rockland Avenue, Staten Island, NY 10306By bus from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the S57 bus to the Brielle and Rockland Avenue stop. Cross the street at the light.

properties.name: Inwood Hill Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Seaman Ave, New York, NYContains the last natural forest and salt marsh in Manhattan. Native tulip trees, great views

properties.name: Jacques Torres Chocolate
properties.description: Posted by System 60 Water St., Brooklyn, NYThe lines begin forming as soon as the doors open on winter weekends. Rich, creamy, satiny smooth . . . really indescribable. He specializes in fresh, hand-crafted chocolates free of preservatives and artificial flavors. (Fromers)

properties.name: Jacques Torres Chocolate Haven
properties.description: Posted by System 350 Hudson St., NY, NYThe lines begin forming as soon as the doors open on winter weekends. Rich, creamy, satiny smooth . . . really indescribable. He specializes in fresh, hand-crafted chocolates free of preservatives and artificial flavors

properties.name: Juniper Valley Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    75TH ST, QUEENS, NYSledding hills

properties.name: Kissena Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    The park\'\'s natural lake is hundreds of years old. The word "Kissena" means "it is cold" in the Chippewa language. Sledding on the East side of the lake.

properties.name: La Flor Bakery and Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System 53-02 Roosevelt Ave., Woodside, Queens, NY The cinnamon and almond overtones of Mexican- made chocolate can be overpowering, so Chef Viko Ortiz subdues Mexican Ibarra with Belgian Callebaut to create a hot chocolate that is gutsy and refined. (NYNewsday)

properties.name: La Maison du Chocolat
properties.description: Posted by System30 Rockefeller Plaza, NY, NYAmerican outpost of Robert Linxes Paris- based chocolate empire. Take a seat at the bar, and one of the uniformed attendants will serve you an elegant cup of either Caracas, pungent and bittersweet, or Guayaquil, a milder semisweet blend. (NYNewsday)

properties.name: La Maison du Chocolat - Madison Ave
properties.description: Posted by System1018 Madison Ave, New York, NYIts the priciest cup, but the bittersweet Caracas just might be the richest and most deeply chocolatey. (NYNewsday)

properties.name: Latourette Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Some of the best sledding in Staten Island

properties.name: Leonidas chocolate shop
properties.description: Posted by System 485 Madison Ave, NY, NY 10022Belgian hot chocolate at the café.

properties.name: Lower Highland Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Baseball fields in the summer, sledding in the winter

properties.name: Lunettes et Chocolat
properties.description: Posted by System 25 Prince St, NY, NYAn inspired pairing. Lunettes et Chocolat caters to two of a girl\'s favorite things--sunglasses and chocolate--as well as jewelry, hats, and other assorted confections. The Cacao bar serves up Mexican hot chocolate, along with handmade chocolates. Italian hard candies, gourmet lollipops, organic teas, cookies from Japan, and English preserves. Mais oui! (StyleMaven)

properties.name: Mariebelle
properties.description: Posted by Polock484 Broome Street, New York, NY 10013Here, you can enjoy a leisurely lunch followed by a cup of our famously rich, smooth Aztec hot chocolate.

properties.name: Monument Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Monument Hill is above the Sugar Bowl on 9th St.

properties.name: Morningside Heights Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Lots of sledding variety for such a small park. There are five blocks of steep and shallow slopes, but also staircases and ledges. Great park for beginners and experts.

properties.name: Nethermead
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Surrounded on all sides by water and hills, you get the impression of being deep in the forest. Some of the oldest trees in the park surround Nethermead.

properties.name: Norma's
properties.description: Posted by System W. 57th St., NY, NYLocated in Le Parker Meridien, there is a trio of hot chocolates all made with Valrhona chocolate. There is traditional; chocolatte, with whipped cream and chocolate shavings; and cocospresso, a superstrong chocolate concoction with a dense pudding-like consistency. The treats run -. (NYDailyNews)

properties.name: Once Upon a Tart
properties.description: Posted by Beaglebot 135 Sullivan Street, New York, NY 10012Back to school are are three little words that inspire not only parents, but Once Upon A Tart as well. At this wonderful little cafe/bakery, they\'re words that might be...cookies! Check out the cool tin lunch boxes, filled with cookies in the shape of pencils, erasers, a sheet of lined paper and an apple.

properties.name: Owl's Head Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Fun sledding. Also home of the Millenium Skateboarding Park.

properties.name: Payard
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor1032 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY, 10019You can pop into Francois Payard for a cup of his signature French-style hot chocolate.

properties.name: Petite Abeille - Broadway
properties.description: Posted by System 134 West Broadway, NY, NYBelgian bistro. Good burgers, hot chocolate, coffee. (Gothamist)

properties.name: Petite Abeille - Greenwich Village
properties.description: Posted by System 466 Hudson St., NY, NYBelgian bistro. Good burgers, hot chocolate, coffee. (Gothamist)

properties.name: Petite Abeille - W. 18th
properties.description: Posted by System 107 West 18th St., NY, NYBelgian bistro. Good burgers, hot chocolate, coffee. (Gothamist)

properties.name: Pilgrim Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This is one of the most popular sledding hills in the city. It can be a little bit crowded.

properties.name: Riverside Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding hills are not crowded because of the proximity to Central Park, which draws the crowds. Great views, some obstacle trees.

properties.name: SQC.
properties.description: Posted by System270 Columbus St, NY, NYYou can go in any time of day to get hot chocolate at the bar. Chef Scott Campbell loads his brew (seven varieties) with Valrhona chocolate and cocoa, and then gilds the lily with a dollop of tightly whipped cream. Also offered are gift certificates that entitle the bearer to all the hot chocolate they can drink in a single sitting; the cost is 0, with 20 percent of the proceeds going to City Harvest. The hot chocolate is nicknamed Life in a Cup on the menu. It has been described as pudding-like. (NYNewsday)

properties.name: Saint Nicholas Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    landscape architect Samuel Parsons designed this park. He said, "a dominant note must be followed with a harmonious treatment, a high hill made higher, a rugged slope more rugged, a deep valley made deeper..." He must have been thinking of sledders!

properties.name: Shore Road Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding hills

properties.name: Soho Cupcake Company - 72nd St
properties.description: Posted by System  176 W. 72nd Street, New York, NY 10023Soho Cupcake Company offers an inviting atmosphere, delicious cupcakes, and a great activity for kids. Drop by the shop for CremaLita fat-free ice cream, as well as a variety of delicious cookies, muffins, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Soho Cupcake Company - E. 59th
properties.description: Posted by Klever  989 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022Soho Cupcake Company offers an inviting atmosphere, delicious cupcakes, and a great activity for kids. Drop by the shop for CremaLita fat-free ice cream, as well as a variety of delicious cookies, muffins, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate.

properties.name: Soho Cupcake Company - W. 112th
properties.description: Posted by System  2873 Broadway, New York, NY 10025Soho Cupcake Company offers an inviting atmosphere, delicious cupcakes, and a great activity for kids. Drop by the shop for CremaLita fat-free ice cream, as well as a variety of delicious cookies, muffins, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate.

properties.name: Sunset Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    SUNSET PARK. There is a magnificent view of the Manhattan skyline as well as New Jersey and Staten Island.

properties.name: The Fix
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing       110 Bedford Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11211If you hang out long enough at the Fix on a Saturday afternoon, you will see every person you know in Williamsburg. Kids love it. Lots of comfy seating. Never feels crowded because its so big inside.

properties.name: Time Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System  380 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10003This airy, bright loft space is just right for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. There is no kids menu, but the staff are accomodating, and there is enough of variety on the menu to satisfy most picky palates. Booster seats, high chairs, and crayons are available.

properties.name: Time Cafe
properties.description: Posted by System  2330 Broadway, NY, NYThis airy, bright loft space is just right for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. There isnt a kids menu, but the staff are accomodating, and there is enough of variety on the menu to satisfy most picky palates. Booster seats, high chairs, and crayons are available. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Van Cortland Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Good sledding for the little ones.

properties.name: Vosges Haute Chocolat
properties.description: Posted by Dailyeats132 Spring Street, New York, NY 10012One of the finest chocolatiers of the city, renowned for their truffles and hot chocolate. (Gothamist)

properties.name: Witchcraft - 12th Ave
properties.description: Posted by System 224 Twelfth Ave., NY, NYA perfect balance of spice and chocolate. Pros: Not overwhelmingly sweet or chocolatey, thanks in part to infused bay leaves, which give the drink a nice kick. Stylishly minimalist sandwich shop, with its gleaming lablike kitchen and tantalizing melted-cheese aroma. (NewYorkMetro)

properties.name: Witchcraft - Greenwich
properties.description: Posted by Dailyeats 397 Greenwich St., NY, NYA perfect balance of spice and chocolate. Not overwhelmingly sweet or chocolatey, thanks in part to infused bay leaves, which give the drink a nice kick. Stylishly minimalist sandwich shop, with its gleaming lablike kitchen and tantalizing melted-cheese aroma. (NYMetro)

properties.name: Zebulon Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Rafaelsidi     258 Wythe Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11211Zebulon offers a modest snack menu (with some dishes that might be a challenge to younger palates), and sometimes hosts family-friendly concerts and poetry readings.
